intro: Rubus colemannii subsp. gremlii, commonly known as the Gremli’s blackberry, is a shrub native to the western United States. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its prickly stems and clusters of small, dark berries. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, with serrated edges, and its flowers are white with five petals. The subsp. gremlii is distinguished by its smaller fruit size and more compact growth form compared to other Rubus species.
